result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
8:35AM  - Case not called on the Record
Attorney Alissa Schaller in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Brandon N Piasecki in court.  
Defendant requests that the Court appoint counsel.
Court will appoint counsel.
Defendant to pay $30.00 per month commencing 11-15-2022.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to use/possess any Nitro Oxide.Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions.

2:48 PM Defendant Brandon N Piasecki in court, in custody.  State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula, as a friend of the court.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
